p: Consequently, there is enough evidence to conclude that a healthy diet and lifestyle are our best weapons in the fight against cardiovascular diseases and the most effective means in which to prevent the occurrence of CVDs in society. A case study showed that mortality due to ischaemic heart disease and prevalence of coronary arteriosclerosis were low in Greenlandic Inuit (Greenlanders). Since the first description of the so-called Inuit paradox in the 1970s, the number of studies and publications associating polyunsaturated fatty acids intake with lower risk of cardiac disorders has grown extensively [ 5, 6, 7].
